Link in header navigation
Link in header navigation
Button. Submit PIN
Link to PIN manual
Link to PIN manual

TR_DEVICE_YOU_RECONNECTED_IS_DIFFERENT.source: Device you reconnected is different from the previous device. Connect the right one or refresh your internet browser and start again.

meta.comment: Text that indicates that user reconnected different device than he was working with before

TR_CONNECTED_DEVICE_IS_IN_BOOTLOADER.source: Connected device is in bootloader mode. Reconnect it to continue.

meta.comment: Text that indicates that user connected device in bootloader mode

TR_DEVICE_IS_USED_IN_OTHER_WINDOW_HEADIN.source: Device is used in other window

TR_DEVICE_IS_USED_IN_OTHER_WINDOW_TEXT.source: This is a big no no. Please dont use device in other window. Close all other windows or tabs that might be using your Trezor device.

TR_ENTER_PIN_TEXT.source: Your device gets locked anytime you disconnect it. You now need to enter your PIN to continue.

TR_RECONNECT_TEXT.source: We lost connection with your device. This might mean:

TR_RECONNECT_TROUBLESHOOT_CABEL.source: Cable is broken, try another one

TR_RECONNECT_TROUBLESHOOT_CONNECTION.source: Device is not well connected to the cable

TR_RECONNECT_TROUBLESHOOT_BRIDGE.source: Trezor bridge might have stopped working, try restarting

TR_BACKUP_INSTRUCTION.source: Now your device is going to show you 24 words to backup your wallet. Write them down. Do not disconnect your device.

meta.comment: The last instruction before initiating backup process
Button text. Ok, Lets go, or something similar.

TR_WRITE_DOWN_NTH_WORD.source: Write down {NthWord} from your device to your recovery seed card.

meta.comment: Ordinal number of word that is currently displayed on Trezor device. For example: Check 1. word.
Ordinal number of word that is currently displayed on Trezor device.
Ordinal number. For example: 1. word
Heading in start page

TR_BACKUP_SUBHEADING_1.source: Your recovery seed is the backup key to all your cryptocurrencies and applications.

meta.comment: Explanation what recovery seed is

TR_BACKUP_SUBHEADING_2.source: Your recovery seed can only be displayed once. Never make a digital copy of your recovery seed and never upload it online. Keep your recovery seed in a safe place.

meta.comment: Explanation what recovery seed is

TR_DO_NOT_UPLOAD_INSTRUCTION.source: Do not upload words on the internet

meta.comment: Instruction what user should never do with his seed.
Instruction what user should do with his seed.

TR_DO_NOT_SAFE_IN_COMPUTER_INSTRUCTION.source: Do not write it into a computer

meta.comment: Instruction what user should never do with his seed.

TR_DO_NOT_TAKE_PHOTO_INSTRUCTION.source: Do not take a photo of your recovery seed

meta.comment: Instruction what user should never do with his seed.

TR_SEED_IS_MORE_IMPORTANT_THAN_YOUR_DEVI.source: Seed is more important than your device

meta.comment: Instruction what user should never do with his seed.

TR_SATOSHILABS_CANNOT_BE_HELD_RESPONSIBL.source: SatoshiLabs cannot be held responsible for security liabilities or financial losses resulting from not following security instructions described here.

meta.comment: Liability disclaimer.

TR_I_HAVE_READ_INSTRUCTIONS.source: I have read the instructions and agree

meta.comment: Checkbox text
Button text
Error message

TR_DEVICE_DISCONNECTED_DURING_ACTION_DES.source: You device disconnected during action which resulted in interuption of backup process. For security reasons you need to wipe your device now and start the backup process again.

meta.comment: Error message. Instruction what to do.
Button text

TR_BACKUP_FINISHED_TEXT.source: Backup is now on your recovery seed card. Once again dont lose it and keep it private!

meta.comment: Text that appears after backup is finished
Exit button after backup is finished
Heading in bookmark step

TR_BOOKMARK_SUBHEADING.source: Protect yourself against {TR_PHISHING_ATTACKS}. Bookmark Trezor Wallet (wallet.trezor.io) to avoid visiting fake sites.

meta.comment: Heading in bookmark step
Term, type of hacker attack trying to fool user to enter his sensitive data into a fake site.
We want user to pres Ctrl + D
Heading on bridge page

TR_BRIDGE_SUBHEADING.source: Trezor Bridge is a communication tool to facilitate the connection between your Trezor and your internet browser.

meta.comment: Description what Trezor Bridge is
Download button

TR_BRIDGE_IS_RUNNING.source: Trezor bridge is up and running

meta.comment: Text that indicates that browser can communicate with Trezor Bridge.
Message to show after user clicks download bridge.
Bridge status in box next to heading
Instruction for installing Trezor Bridge

TR_DOUBLE_CLICK_IT_TO_RUN_INSTALLER.source: Double click it to run installer

meta.comment: Instruction for installing Trezor Bridge
Instruction for installing Trezor Bridge
Indication that device is in bootloader mode

TR_DEVICE_IN_BOOTLOADER_MODE_INSTRUCTION.source: Device is connected in bootloader mode. Plug out the USB cable and connect device again.

meta.comment: Instructions what to do if device is in bootloader mode
Indication that device is in already initialized
Display label of device
Display firmware of device

TR_USER_HAS_WORKDED_WITH_THE_DEVICE.source: I have worked with it before

meta.comment: Option to click when troubleshooting initialized device.

TR_USER_HAS_NOT_WORKDED_WITH_THIS_DEVICE.source: It is a brand new device, just unpacked

meta.comment: Option to click when troubleshooting initialized device.

TR_INSTRUCTION_TO_SKIP_OR_WIPE.source: You might skip setup and continue to wallet or wipe your device to be able to go through the onboarding process again.

meta.comment: Instruction what to do when user knows the device he is holding was manipulated by him, not someone else.

TR_WIPE_WARNING.source: Danger zone here, wiping device erases all data and can not be reverted

meta.comment: Wipe device action warning.

TR_USER_HAS_NOT_WORKED_WITH_THIS_DEVICE_.source: In that case you should immediately contact Trezor support with detailed information on your purchase and refrain from using this device.

meta.comment: What to do if device is already initialized but not by user.

TR_SEARCHING_TAKES_TOO_LONG.source: Searching for your device takes too long, you might want to try to:

meta.comment: Message to display when device is not detected after a decent period of time.

TR_RECONNECT_INSTRUCTION.source: Reconnect your device and wait for a while

meta.comment: Troubleshooting instruction
Troubleshooting instruction
Troubleshooting instruction
Troubleshooting instruction. See TR_CONTACT_TREZOR_SUPPORT_LINK
Full sentences: If nothing helps, contact Trezor support. See TR_LAST_RESORT_INSTRUCTION
Heading on connect page

TR_MAKE_SURE_IT_IS_WELL_CONNECTED.source: Make sure your device is well connected to avoid communication failures.

meta.comment: Instruction for connecting device.
Indication that we app does not see connected device yet.
App can see connected device

TR_FOUND_OK_DEVICE.source: Found an empty device, yay! You can continue now.

meta.comment: Case when device was connected and it is in expected state (not initialized)
Heading in newsletter step

TR_FINAL_SUBHEADING.source: Now you are ready to enjoy bleeding edge security with Trezor.

meta.comment: Subheading in newsletter step
Name of application that might be used with Trezor

TR_TREZOR_STABLE_WALLET_DESCRIPTION.source: Web wallet with support of Bitcoin, Dash, Zcash and other coins.

meta.comment: Description of application that might be used with Trezor.
Name of application that might be used with Trezor

TR_TREZOR_PASSWORD_MANAGER_DESCRIPTION.source: A safe way how to manage your credentials with Trezor.

meta.comment: Description of application that might be used with Trezor
Name of application that might be used with Trezor

TR_TREZOR_ETHEREUM_WALLET_DESCRIPTION.source: New wallet with support of Ethereum and Ripple

meta.comment: Description of application that might be used with Trezor
Heading on firmware page

TR_FIRMWARE_SUBHEADING.source: Your Trezor is shipped without firmware installed to ensure that you can get started with the latest features right away. The authenticity of the installed firmware is always checked during device start. If the firmware is not correctly signed by SatoshiLabs, your Trezor will display a warning.

meta.comment: Main text on firmware page for devices without firmware.
Install button
Error message when installing firmware to device
Error message when downloading firmware

TR_FIRMWARE_INSTALLED.source: Perfect. The newest firmware is installed. Time to continue

meta.comment: Message to display in case firmware is installed
Prompt to connect device.
Prompt to disconnect device.

TR_WAIT_FOR_REBOOT.source: Wait for your device to reboot

meta.comment: Info what is happening with users device.

TR_FIRMWARE_INSTALLED_TEXT.source: This device has already installed firmware version: {version}

meta.comment: Text to display in case device has firmware installed but it is outdated
Heading on hologram step page

TR_HOLOGRAM_STEP_SUBHEADING.source: Please make sure hologram protecting your device is authentic

meta.comment: Subheading on hologram step page
Button to click in allright case
Button to click when hologram looks different
Part of sentence TR_DID_YOU_PURCHASE. Link to page with trusted resellers list
Part of sentence TR_DID_YOU_PURCHASE. Link to support
Part of sentence TR_DID_YOU_PURCHASE. Link to support

TR_DID_YOU_PURCHASE.source: Please note, that device packaging including holograms have changed over time. You can check packaging details {TR_PACKAGING_LINK}. Also be sure you made your purchase from {TR_RESELLERS_LINK}. Otherwise device you are holding in your hands might be a counterfeit. Please {TR_CONTACT_OUR_SUPPORT_LINK}

meta.comment: Text to display when user is unhappy with his hologram.
Heading in name step
Subheading in name step after user changes label, so lets welcome him!

TR_NAME_SUBHEADING.source: Personalize your device with your own name.

meta.comment: Subheading in name step

TR_NAME_CHANGED_TEXT.source: Excellent, your device has a custom name now. It will be visible on your device display from now on.

meta.comment: Text to display after user has changed label.

TR_NAME_ONLY_ASCII.source: Name can contain only basic letters

meta.comment: Validation message in label input
Validation message in label input
Validation message in label input

TR_NAME_BORING.source: Nah.. too boring, chose a different label

meta.comment: User shouldnt use My Trezor (default name) as their new custom name
Heading in newsletter step

TR_NEWSLETTER_SUBHEADING.source: Receive information on important security updates

meta.comment: Subheading in newsletter step

TR_THANK_YOU_FOR_EMAIL.source: Thank you for providing your email. You can also follow us on socials:

meta.comment: Displayed after user submits contact email

TR_EMAIL_SKIPPED.source: You chose not to provide your email. This is Ok. If you want, you might still follow us on socials:

meta.comment: Displayed after user skips contact email
Indicating progress status of email after submit.
Indicating progress status of email after submit.
Validation text displayed under email input
Heading in PIN page when entering PIN for the first time
Heading in PIN page when repeating PIN
Heading in PIN page when PIN set
Heading in PIN page when PIN repeated incorrectly

TR_PIN_SUBHEADING.source: Protect device from unauthorized access by using a strong pin.

meta.comment: Subheading on PIN page
Button text

TR_PIN_ENTERING_DESCRIPTION.source: In order to secure maximum security, we do not display pin on your computer. We will just show a blind matrix, real layout is displayed on your device.

meta.comment: Text describe how to enter PIN o trezor device

TR_FIRST_PIN_ENTERED.source: Good. You entered a new pin. But to make sure you did not make mistake, please enter it again. Look at your device now, numbers are now different.

meta.comment: Text describing what happens after user enters PIN for the first time.

TR_PIN_SET_SUCCESS.source: Purfect! Your device is now secured by pin.

meta.comment: Longer text indicating PIN was set succesfully.

TR_PIN_ERROR_TROUBLESHOOT.source: Are you confused, how PIN works? You can always refer to our {TR_DOCUMENTATION}

meta.comment: Troubleshooting text after user enters second PIN incorrectly.
Link to trezor documentation (wiki)
Button text
Heading in security page

TR_SECURITY_SUBHEADING.source: Good job, your wallet is ready. But we strongly recommend you to spend few more minutes and improve your security.

meta.comment: Text in security page
Button in security page (start security setup)
Button in security page (skip security setup)
Heading on select your device page
Name of Trezor model 1
Name of Trezor model T
Heading in recover page

TR_RECOVER_SUBHEADING.source: It is possible to re-create device from bip39 backup. First of all, chose number of words of your backup.

meta.comment: Subheading in recover page. Basic info about recovery

TR_RECOVER_SUBHEADING_MODEL_T.source: On model T the entire recovery process is doable on device.

meta.comment: Subheading in recover page. Basic info about recovery
Number of words. For example: 12 words
Button.

TR_RECOVERY_TYPES_DESCRIPTION.source: Both methods are safe. Basic recovery uses on computer input of words in randomized order. Advanced recovery uses on-screen input to load your recovery seed. {TR_LEARN_MORE_LINK}

meta.comment: There are two methods of recovery for T1. This is a short explanation text.
Button for selecting basic recovery option
Button for selecting advanced recovery option

TR_ENTER_SEED_WORDS_INSTRUCTION.source: Enter words from your seed in order displayed on your device.

meta.comment: User is instructed to enter words from seed (backup) into the form in browser

TR_RANDOM_SEED_WORDS_DISCLAIMER.source: Please note, that to maximaze security, your device will ask you to enter {count} fake words that are not part of your seed.

meta.comment: User is instructed to enter words from seed (backup) into the form in browser
Placeholder in seed input asking user to pay attention to his device
How many words will user need to enter before recovery is finished.
Error during recovery. For example wrong word retyped or device disconnected

TR_RECOVERY_SUCCESS.source: Excellent, you recovered device from seed.

meta.comment: This is displayed upon successful recovery
